meanings.definition: The act of determining or deciding in advance.
meanings.sent1: Her predetermination to study hard paid off when she aced the exam.
meanings.sent2: The team's predetermination to win the championship was evident in their intense training.
meanings.sent3: His predetermination to eat all the cookies before dinner led to a funny cookie crumb trail.
meanings.sent4: The predetermination of the storm's arrival made everyone rush to secure their belongings.
meanings.sent5: The predetermination of the plot twist left the audience in awe.

meanings.definition: The belief that all events are already decided or influenced by a higher power.
meanings.sent1: Their predetermination in fate guided their decisions throughout life.
meanings.sent2: The ancient civilization's predetermination in destiny shaped their rituals and traditions.
meanings.sent3: The cat's predetermination in catching the laser pointer entertained the whole family.
meanings.sent4: The predetermination of the sunrise painted the sky in beautiful hues.
meanings.sent5: The predetermination of the prophecy kept the villagers on edge.
